  • FacetSlider

Coveo component FacetSlider

The FacetSlider component allows to create a facet that renders a slider widget to filter on a range of numerical values rather than the classic multi-select facet with a label and a count for each values.
Note that this component does NOT inherit from a standard Facet, and thus does not offer all the same options. Also note that many options for the slider component cannot be set as an HTML attribute on the component, and must be configured in javascript

A generic example on how to initialize a complex slider

// Using a JSON object inside the init call. Note that the JSON object follows the options described in this page.
Coveo.init(document.querySelector('#search'), {
   FacetSlider: {
     field: "@size",
     start: 1000,
     end: 5000,
     rangeSlider: true,
     graph: {
       steps: 10
     }
   }
})

// OR using the jquery extension

$('#search').coveo('init', {
   FacetSlider: {
     field: "@size",
     start: 1000,
     end: 5000,
     rangeSlider: true,
     graph: {
       steps: 10
     }
   }
})

// Same config, but using attribute directly on the element instead
<div class='CoveoFacetSlider' data-field='@syssize' data-start='1000' data-end='5000' data-range-slider='true' data-graph-steps='10'></div>

Component Options

dateField

dateField: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :91

Specifies whether the field for which you are requesting a range is a date field.
This allow the facet to correctly build the outgoing group by request, as well as render it correctly.

dateFormat

dateFormat: string
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :111

Specifies the format used to display values if they are date.
Default value is MMM dd, yyyy

displayAsPercent

displayAsPercent: any
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :175

Specifies the percentage caption that you want to display the field values.
Available options are :

  • enable : (data-display-as-percent-enable) boolean : Specifies wether the caption should be displayed as a percentage. Default is false
  • separator : (data-display-as-percent-separator) string : Specifies the character(s) to use as a separator in the caption. Default is -.

displayAsValue

displayAsValue: any
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :160

Specifies the caption that you want to display the field values.
Available options are :

  • enable : (data-display-as-value-enable) boolean : Specifies wether the caption should be displayed as a value. Default is true
  • unitSign : (data-display-as-value-unit-sign) string : Specifies the unit sign for this value.
  • separator : (data-display-as-value-separator) string : Specifies the character(s) to use as a separator in the caption. Default is -.

enableResponsiveMode

enableResponsiveMode: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :264

Specifies if the responsive mode should be enabled on the facets. Responsive mode will make the facet dissapear and instead be availaible using a dropdown button. Responsive facets are enabled when the width of the element the search interface is bound to reaches 800 pixels. This value can be modified using {@link Facet..optionsresponsiveBreakpoint}. The default value is true.

end

end: string
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :129

Specifies the ending boundary of the slider.
Dates values are rounded on the year when the field used is a date type.
Optional: Takes the highest value available in the index by default.

excludeOuterBounds

excludeOuterBounds: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :134

Specifies if you want to exclude the outer bounds of your slider in the generated query, when they are not active.
Default value is false

field

field: string
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :97

Specifies the index field whose values will be use in the facet.
This require the given field to be configured correctly in the index as a facet field.
This is a required option and cannot be omitted, otherwise the facet component will not work.

getSteps

getSteps: function
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :227

Specifies a function that will generate the steps for the slider. The function receives the slider boundaries must return an array of number (the steps).

Coveo.init(document.querySelector('#search'), {
   FacetSlider: {
     field: "@size",
     getSteps: function(start, end) {
       return [0,2,4,6,8,10];
     }
   }
})

// OR using the jquery extension

$('#search').coveo('init', {
   FacetSlider: {
       field: "@size",
       getSteps: function(start, end) {
           return [0,2,4,6,8,10];
       }
   }
})

Type declaration

    • (start: number, end: number): number[]

    • Parameters

      • start: number
      • end: number

      Returns number[]

graph

graph: any
  • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :188

Specifies that you wish to display a small graph on top of the slider.
Available options are :

  • steps: (data-graph-steps) number : Specifies the number of steps/columns to display in your graph. Default value is 10

    • id

    id: string
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :104

    Specifies a unique identifier for a facet. This identifier will be used to save the facet state in the url hash, for example.
    Optional, since the default will be the FacetSlider.options.field option.
    If you have two facets with the same field on the same page, you should specify an id for at least one of those two facets.
    That id need to be unique on the page.

    queryOverride

    queryOverride: string
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :117

    Specifies the query to filter automatic minimum and maximum range of the slider.
    This is especially useful for date range, where the index may contain values which are not set, and thus the automatic range will return value from the year 1400 (min date from the boost c++ library)
    Can be used to do something like queryOverride : @date>2000/01/01 or some arbitrary date which will filter out unwanted values

    rangeSlider

    rangeSlider: boolean
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :150

    Specifies whether you want a slider with two buttons, or only one.
    Optional. By default only one button appears in the slider.

    responsiveBreakpoint

    responsiveBreakpoint: number
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :271

    Specifies the width of the search interface, in pixels, at which the facets will go into responsive mode. The responsive mode will be triggered when the width is equal or below this value. The search interface corresponds to the element with the class CoveoSearchInterface. The default value is 800.

    rounded

    rounded: number
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :139

    Specifies to how many decimal digit displayed numerical values are rounded.
    Optional. By default, the number rounds to 0 decimal digits.

    start

    start: string
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :123

    Specifies the starting boundary of the slider.
    Dates values are rounded on the year when the field used is a date type.
    Optional: Takes the lowest value available in the index by default.

    steps

    steps: number
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :145

    Specifies the number of steps that you want in your slider.
    For example, if your range is [ 0 , 100 ] and you specify 10 steps, then the end user is allowed to move the slider only to the values [ 0, 10, 20. 30 ... , 100 ].
    Optional. By default the slider will allow all values.

    title

    title: string
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :86

    The title on top of the facet component.
    Default value is the localized string for 'No title'

    valueCaption

    valueCaption: function
    • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :255

    Specifies a function that will generate the caption for the slider. Receives the current slider values (number[]) and must return the caption (string).

    Coveo.init(document.querySelector('#search'), {
   FacetSlider: {
     field: "@size",
     valueCaption: function(values) {
       return values[0] + " hello" + ", " + values[1] + " world";
     }
   }
})

// OR using the jquery extension

$('#search').coveo('init', {
   FacetSlider: {
     field: "@size",
     valueCaption: function(values) {
       return values[0] + " hello" + ", " + values[1] + " world";
     }
   }
})

      • (values: number[]): string

      • Parameters

        • values: number[]

        Returns string

    getSelectedValues

    • getSelectedValues(): number[]
      • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :367

      Return the current selection in the facet, as an array of number (eg : [start, end] ).
      If it's not available, return [undefined, undefined]

      Returns number[]

    isActive

    • isActive(): boolean
      • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :391

      Return true if the slider is "active" (will output an expression in the query when a search is performed)

      Returns boolean

    reset

    • reset(): void
      • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :354

      Reset the facet. This means set the range value as inactive.

      Returns void

    setSelectedValues

    • setSelectedValues(values: number[]): void
      • Defined in src/ui/FacetSlider/FacetSlider.ts :379

      Set the selected values in the slider.

      Parameters

      Returns void

    Static get

    • get(element: HTMLElement, componentClass?: any, noThrow?: boolean): BaseComponent

    • Inherited from Component.get

      • Defined in src/ui/Base/Component.ts :177

      Get the bound component to the given HTMLElement. Throws an assert if the HTMLElement has no component bound, unless using the noThrow argument
      If there is multiple component bound to the current HTMLElement, you must specify the component class

      Parameters

      • element: HTMLElement

        HTMLElement for which to get the bound component

      • Optional componentClass: any

        Optional component class. If the HTMLElement has multiple components bound, you must specify which one you are targeting

      • Optional noThrow: boolean

        Boolean option to tell the method to not throw on error

      Returns BaseComponent

    constructor

    • new FacetSlider(element: HTMLElement, type: string, bindings?: IComponentBindings): FacetSlider

    • Inherited from Component.constructor

      • Defined in src/ui/Base/Component.ts :89

      Create a new Component. Resolve all IComponentBindings if not provided.
      Create a new Logger for this component. Attach the component to the SearchInterface

      Parameters

      • element: HTMLElement

        The HTMLElement on which to create the component. Used to bind data on the element.

      • type: string

        The unique identifier for this component. See : IComponentDefinition.ID. Used to generate the unique Coveo CSS class associated with every component

      • Default value bindings: IComponentBindings = {}

        The environment for every component. Optional, but omitting to provide one will impact performance.

      Returns FacetSlider
